name: github_bulk_star
description: Star multiple GitHub repositories in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling github_star_repo multiple times. Pass repo URLs as a comma-separated string.

detailSteps.code: const allBtns = document.querySelectorAll('button'); let starBtn = null; let alreadyStarred = false; for (const btn of allBtns) { const text = btn.textContent.trim().toLowerCase(); const label = (btn.getAttribute('aria-label') || '').toLowerCase(); if (text === 'star' || label.includes('star this repository') || label === 'star') { starBtn = btn; break; } if (text === 'starred' || text === 'unstar' || label.includes('unstar this repository') || label === 'unstar') { alreadyStarred = true; break; } } if (!starBtn && !alreadyStarred) { starBtn = document.querySelector('[data-ga-click*="star"] button, form.unstarred button, form[action*="/star"] button'); } if (!starBtn && !alreadyStarred) { const starred = document.querySelector('form.starred button, form[action*="/unstar"] button'); if (starred) alreadyStarred = true; } if (alreadyStarred) return { status: 'already_starred', repo: window.location.pathname.substring(1) }; if (!starBtn) return { status: 'error', repo: window.location.pathname.substring(1), message: 'Star button not found' }; starBtn.click(); await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 1500)); return { status: 'starred', repo: window.location.pathname.substring(1) }
